test_cases.description: Patient with unexpected ICU admission due to uncontrolled pain post-surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-02T09:00Z]: Patient was admitted for scoliosis surgery. Post-operative day one, the patient reported pain out of proportion to injury, requiring increased analgesic management. Due to persistent severe pain and inability to manage discomfort, the patient was transferred unexpectedly to the ICU for closer monitoring.

expected_signals.signal_id: Pain out of proportion to injury
required_provenance: pain out of proportion to injury
increased analgesic management
transferred unexpectedly to the ICU

test_cases.description: Patient readmitted due to surgical site infection after discharge.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-03T10:30Z]: The patient presented with fever and erythema at the surgical site five days post-discharge. Upon examination, there was notable wound drainage and increased back pain. A surgical site infection was diagnosed, necessitating readmission for IV antibiotics and further evaluation.

required_provenance: notable wound drainage and increased back pain
A surgical site infection was diagnosed
necessitating readmission for IV antibiotics

test_cases.description: Patient returned to OR for hardware complication after initial scoliosis surgery.

test_cases.description: Patient readmitted due to pneumonia after scoliosis surgery.

test_cases.description: Patient exhibits gastrointestinal symptoms following scoliosis surgery but was diagnosed with a viral infection unrelated to the procedure.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-02T09:00Z]: Patient was admitted with abdominal pain and nausea three days post-operative. The symptoms were evaluated and found to be due to a viral gastroenteritis, not related to the scoliosis surgery.

test_cases.description: Patient presents with severe back pain unrelated to surgical site complications, instead due to a pre-existing condition.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-03T11:30Z]: Patient returned to the clinic complaining of severe back pain. After examination, it was determined that the pain stemmed from an underlying herniated disc, not from the surgery for idiopathic scoliosis.

test_cases.description: Patient experiences delayed wound healing due to unrelated systemic illness, not surgical site infection.

test_cases.description: Patient presents with respiratory symptoms unrelated to surgery, diagnosed as asthma exacerbation.

test_cases.description: Patient experiences urinary retention post-surgery due to medication side effects, not related to the surgical procedure.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-06T15:10Z]: During follow-up, the patient reported urinary retention. Evaluation revealed that the issue was caused by the recent pain medication prescribed, not a complication from the surgery.

required_provenance: the issue was caused by the recent pain medication prescribed, not a complication from the surgery.

test_cases.description: A 17-year-old patient with scoliosis experiences severe back pain post-surgery but is found to have no complications.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-01T11:00Z]: The patient is a 17-year-old female diagnosed with idiopathic scoliosis who underwent corrective surgery. Post-operative day 3, she reports severe back pain, but imaging shows no hardware issues or signs of infection. Pain management plan reviewed, and patient was advised on deep breathing exercises.

required_provenance: but imaging shows no hardware issues or signs of infection.

test_cases.description: A 16-year-old exhibits pain and nausea but is diagnosed with a viral illness unrelated to surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-03T13:00Z]: A 16-year-old female with idiopathic scoliosis presented with abdominal pain and nausea two weeks post-operative. Evaluation revealed a viral illness unrelated to her recent scoliosis surgery. Surgical site was clean, and no further intervention was required.

required_provenance: Surgical site was clean, and no further intervention was required.

test_cases.description: A 14-year-old girl has a return trip to the ER for pain but is found to have normal recovery signs.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-04T14:00Z]: 14-year-old female post-scoliosis surgery presented to the ER with complaints of severe back pain. After evaluation, her vitals were stable, and the surgical site showed no signs of infection or hematoma. Pain was attributed to muscle spasms.

required_provenance: the surgical site showed no signs of infection or hematoma.

test_cases.description: A 17-year-old boy is readmitted for social issues post-surgery, unrelated to surgical complications.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-05T15:00Z]: 17-year-old male with recent scoliosis surgery was readmitted primarily due to social issues affecting his recovery, including lack of support at home. No surgical complications were noted, and all discharge instructions had been clear.

required_provenance: No surgical complications were noted, and all discharge instructions had been clear.
